body: No, we don't have plan as there is tech block, which is why we can't transfer Zipkin span to SkyWalking full functional tracing. APM level tracing with analysis is different from what OpenTelemetry defined.

when the `times` is large, the `err chan` does not return first error but the last one, and
when the `interval` parameter is close to the `execute()` timeout, `time.NewTicker` may possibly be executed again. There may be race between two branches.
@wankai123 Where do we build the test service images? I think we built them for testing with some scripts.

> when the `times` is large, the `err chan` does not return first error but the last one,

`err chan` should return the last one, why do you want to return the first one error? For example, if the target service is not ready, trigger request may return error `connection refused`, and after some retries, the service is ready but you request a non-existing path `/api/non-existing`, why would you expect to get the first error (`connection refused`) instead of the last one (`404 Not Found`)?

> @wankai123 Where do we build the test service images? I think we built them for testing with some scripts.

I understand we do not build test-service images now but only mount the jar files into the java agent image.

[`h.times == h.executedCount` makes sure to only send the first error](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-infra-e2e/blob/main/internal/components/trigger/http.go#L82)

according to commnet in code, it means "first". Is the annotation here wrong？

Then if you like agent installed test services, this build should be in Java agent repository.
I thought you just build the mock service images without agent.

Would that be better? Mounting agent into service when needed(in the e2e) only.

> Then if you like agent installed test services, this build should be in Java agent repository.

I agree. Then we can use the built image with `SW_AGENT_JAVA_COMMIT` in the main repo instead of using a mount strategy. I suppose `e2e-service`s rarely change, right?

> Would that be better? Mounting agent into service when needed(in the e2e) only.

If you meant using in `banyandb` repo, I prefer an all-in-one image 😃

What makes all in one necessary? AFAIK, last discussion is about banyandb subproject doesn't want to host Java codes. This PR moves aggressively.

If someone wants to use this pure service, they will face issue again, and we have to deal with similar issues repeatedly. Pure services are common in service mesh.

> What makes all in one necessary? AFAIK, last discussion is about banyandb subproject doesn't want to host Java codes. This PR moves aggressively. 

Sure we can provide pure jre-based images without java agent. But in `banyandb` repo, we have to download a release version of java agent and then mount it as a volume.

> If someone wants to use this pure service, they will face issue again, and we have to deal with similar issues repeatedly. Pure services are common in service mesh.

Well. I don't think it would be a problem if we don't pursue a "minimal" image size. We can always use environment variable (e.g. `JAVA_TOOL_OPTIONS`) to control whether or not we enable the java agent. It is still flexible.

You are asking others could adopt but meanwhile, you could adopt too.
Let's not make things so complex.
Mounting in banyandb e2e seems not an issue. You should know, agent based e2e is only one case only. Banyandb should be verified in the mesh cases too.

> 

Ok, get it, Thanks

> You are asking others could adopt but meanwhile, you could adopt too. Let's not make things so complex. Mounting in banyandb e2e seems not an issue. You should know, agent based e2e is only one case only. Banyandb should be verified in the mesh cases too.

Switch to jre base image now.

Shall we use JDK8 and JDK17 as we did for OAP?

@lujiajing1126 Take a look at the release doc, https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/guides/how-to-release/#publish-the-docker-images. At the latest step, we need to push the image to dockerhub, which is sharing the makefile you changed. I think you will make that step fails as no e2e-service repo there, and also the e2e-service images should not be uploaded. I would recommend you to build a new makefile task to do this separatedly.

@kezhenxu94 Need your suggestions here.

> @lujiajing1126 Take a look at the release doc, https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/guides/how-to-release/#publish-the-docker-images. At the latest step, we need to push the image to dockerhub, which is sharing the makefile you changed. I think you will make that step fails as no e2e-service repo there, and also the e2e-service images should not be uploaded. I would recommend you to build a new makefile task to do this separatedly.
> 
> @kezhenxu94 Need your suggestions here.

Yes agree, it's better to separate the build scripts for test images and product images. Let's create another Makefile in `test/` and use `make -C test push` to push to images.  (I'd not do that although we can include that `test/Makefile` in our main Makefile).

Also, as the test services are rarely changed, we may not want to trigger the push action in every commit and push so many identical images with different tags, we should consider adding a check in that workflow by using `.github/actions/skip/action.yml` to skip unnecessary builds/pushes.

> Also, as the test services are rarely changed, we may not want to trigger the push action in every commit and push so many identical images with different tags

+1, only `test/e2e-v2/java-test-service/e2e-service-provider` and `test/e2e-v2/java-test-service/e2e-service-consumer` changes seem reasonable to push the images.
Thanks to both of you for the information. I will move the `Makefile` to the `test` dir and build a separate workflow to handle this.

Oh, I mean if we bump this up, we need to update changelogs(add section project, take an example of previous release), and links to the ASF change logs, or copy texts.

Such as this

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/changes/changes-8.9.0.md#project

Building env changes are also important for developers, so wr don't want missing them.
To be specific, this file https://github.com/apache/skywalking-python/blob/master/docs/menu.yml#L43.
No update in months.
Where is the document and how to resolve it? thanks!
Which language agent are you asking about?
If this is a bug, please use `bug` template to report.

> Inside the install method, you find out the relevant method(s) of the libraries that you plan to instrument, and create/close spans before/after those method(s).

This is general guidance, not a strict rule. 

Usually, it is also common to intercept or implement filters to get the same purpose. The key point is, your plugin should be auto instrumentation, don't need to change the target service's source codes.

> I was wondering if I make a PR, is interceptors acceptable, or it is a better way to follow what's said in developer guide.

If I understand correctly, you mean you have interceptors that users can use in their code, but SkyWalking Python agent aims to do the interception automatically, so I think what you need is to find out a proper point and insert your interceptors (automatically) into the process chain

@kehuili you can see the same method in our Java agent, we have [interceptor](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/blob/main/apm-sniffer/apm-sdk-plugin/grpc-1.x-plugin/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/plugin/grpc/v1/server/ServerInterceptor.java) and [a point](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/blob/74b130c8271a692a217e629f4126c1043b0204e3/apm-sniffer/apm-sdk-plugin/grpc-1.x-plugin/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/plugin/grpc/v1/server/AbstractServerImplBuilderInterceptor.java#L31-L38) to insert that interceptor automatically.
Assigned to you.
Got it. Gonna find a proper way to implement it.

> Got it. Gonna find a proper way to implement it.

If this is not ready yet, should we move this to the discussion channel?

> If this is not ready yet, should we move this to the discussion channel?

Sure.

We use python-agent, every second, the prometheus to request us the url :"/actuator/prometheus" to our python service， so we do not want to trace the url, so we want to ignore it. But I config it in env of system, but in the ui, the path is also show it.

I think we at least should support (2) and what is your expected length?

This should be easy to fix, do you want to submit a fix?

Hi @wu-sheng , I’m a bit hard to understand doc [https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/blob/main/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/Plugin-test.md] when  I want to create test. It has not obvious step what should I do. 

step0 Environment Requirements
step1 `bash ${SKYWALKING_HOME}/test/plugin/generator.sh`
step2 Adjust the code like  **tomcat-thread-pool-scenario** ？（l can not find tests like tomcat-78x-scenario）
step3  `bash ./test/plugin/run.sh -f ${scenario_name}`
step4 upload to GitHub Actions Job

Is that right ？or need other steps？
First of all, this task could run locally. Adding to GHA is easy like this https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/blob/main/.github/workflows/plugins-test.1.yaml or other plugins-test YMALs.
This is plugin test dev doc, https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/skywalking-java/v8.9.0/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/plugin-test/

> This is plugin test dev doc, https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/skywalking-java/v8.9.0/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/plugin-test/

yeah I have seen this doc. So I raised the above question. Your answer teach me how to do `step4 upload to GitHub Actions Job` but still not solve my main confuse . The specific steps of test what I mentioned above is right or omit something? That doc emphasis on how to config parameters in tests, but have not a clear flow. So it may difficult for beginners to understand（like me）
I am not sure about other questions. Are you facing issues about step 3(local run)? It could be easier to help you.

> I am not sure about other questions. Are you facing issues about step 3(local run)? It could be easier to help you.

ok I'll look into it myself and get back to you if I have any questions
Sure, just follow the steps of that doc, and make sure tests pass locally. The GHA is simple.

> I think we at least should support (2) and what is your expected length? > > This should be easy to fix, do you want to submit a fix? I am glad to submit a fix. Some details need to discuss like you mentioned: 1. Is it proper to truncate the information (or is it necessary to store the whole parameter string)? I find the parameters will be displayed like the screenshot 2. Whether a long-enough column type like 'TEXT' affects the performance, not only in database, other storage types like ES as well

when running an existing feign-scenario test with `bash ./test/plugin/run.sh -f ${scenario_name}` the docker log likes following：

[2022-03-01 07:12:32:057] [ERROR] - org.apache.skywalking.plugin.test.agent.tool.Main.verify(Main.java:53) - 
assert failed.
SegmentItemNotFoundException
expected: feign-scenario
actual: Not Found

What preparations have I missed ？

(1) We should try our best to show all, this would not be queried, right? Just log them for further visualization.
(2) Using TEXT with `storageOnly = true` should not impact the performance. If you just need to read them, but not use it as a query condition, which I think it is your case here.
This error means no `segment` reported, all cases could pass on Linux or Intel Mac.(At least my M1 mac can't run this for now)

I use Intel Mac and try another existing test，but result is the same. Does anyone know why ?

This is not a Skywalking issue, it's a business process issue
1、Could you tell me how the test framework choose the plugin if it has multiple versions (like this case)?
How are you using Tomcat? Could you share? I guess you are using some specific Spring versions?

1. Tomcat container(require a war) is not available for Tomcat 10. @dmsor is planning to add in this week. But it can't change the version from case to case.
This is how it is set
https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/blob/2bd58bce7a95e61eac810ecb6340beaa3dfe3892/test/plugin/scenarios/spring-4.3.x-scenario/configuration.yml#L17

2. Tomcat plugin should be in default like other SpringMVC and Tomcat78 plugins, so you wouldn't require `withPlugins`.
3. To test versions one by one, you need to do 2 things

(1) List all test versions here, https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/blob/main/test/plugin/scenarios/spring-kafka-2.2.x-scenario/support-version.list
(2) Use maven property `test.framework.version` to represent your dependency version in pom.xml. https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/blob/2bd58bce7a95e61eac810ecb6340beaa3dfe3892/test/plugin/scenarios/spring-kafka-2.2.x-scenario/pom.xml#L31
I see the ignore path is write to env, but it not work! @kezhenxu94

Sorry, I can't understand  1 very well 😭，could you  give me more detailed information? Do you mean I should use spring as a server framework（replace the embedded tomcat version）to test instead of using tomcat only ？

For 3 I've already done that. But what I really mean is if there are two plugins(like tomcat78、tomcat10),they enhance the same method，how test framework know which plugin should be choose ?

If you can't follow (1), ignore it. That is just an option.

(3) It is not determined by test framework. You could check witness class and witness method for plugin instrumentation definition. The plugin [dev doc](https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/skywalking-java/v8.9.0/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/java-plugin-development-guide/#implement-plugin) includes this, step 4.
Maybe, just maybe you need to add witness class or method for tomcat78 plugin, which helps disabling the plugin in Tomcat 10 case.

ok，for 3 I got it.

for 1 do you mean that beacuse of tomcat-container uses tomcat:8.5-jdk8-openjdk, tomcat:8.5-jdk14-openjdk or tomcat:8.5-jdk17-openjdk image ，not include tomcat 10.x，and this week tomcat 10.x image is planned to be added,
so I should use jvm container image? That's what I did if that's what you meant.

so In fact I used jvm-container  and tomcat only（without spring）to build server serivce， is that right ?

Yes, that is my (1) means. That could be added later. 

Tomcat in dependency and Tomcat as container likr (1) have different class loader path. That is why we provide 2 ways for you. Once @dmsolr added, you could have 2 plugin test cases. Before that, follow your current way.
Is there any way that starting tomcat with java agent in IDEA (no VM options)so that I can breakpoint debugger like springboot service ?

Do you want to debug the agent plugin? I guess you could read a Chinese blog? https://skywalking.apache.org/zh/2019-01-24-skywalking-remote-debug/ Remote debug is the recommended way to debug in agent case.

> Do you want to debug the agent plugin? I guess you could read a Chinese blog? https://skywalking.apache.org/zh/2019-01-24-skywalking-remote-debug/ Remote debug is the recommended way to debug in agent case.

Earlier, I learn a way to debug agent without remote debug，to set `VM options`(-javaagent) In IDEA and open agent module and test module in the same project. In that way I even can debug the code in `premain` method
But it seems only available for spring service，tomcat application can not set VM options。If using remote debug , I can only debug the code in some _uninitialized logic_ like `beforeMethod` is that right?

Remote debug is open to all cases. Do you need to verify some special cases? I think the Tomcat plugin doesn't require this complex case.
There is a setting in remote debug, `suspend=Y` could make the target service wait for your agent attachment.

> 

thanks~ I will try it
I try it again, in ~/.bashrc to config, the env is right, in /etc/profile to config, the env can not use?@kezhenxu94

I think your question is a little out of the project boundary. You could easily verify whether a system variable is accessible in a python program. We don't care and control where you set, it is OS's responsibility.
@mustangxu Are you going to follow the comments?

Sorry to bother again，I am now in a situation like this：I think that I have already enhanced some method like tomcat78 through debug `AbstractClassEnhancePluginDefine` and `ClassEnhancePluginDefine` They all found  my instrumentation normally and enhance it，like this:

![8620732217524cf1741e0e2c03709be](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33154970/156766101-20fbf277-a638-40e3-a2c0-3d324b1a5fbc.jpg)

but when I take a request the breakpoint in the `beforeMethod` is not be executed.
Could you tell me what this might be? Or how should it be checked?
Then it may be caused by the method not matching. This debug only shows your class declaration works.
And make sure Tomcat78 plugin doesn't override you, make sure your witness class and method works correctly too.

I find the real reason is that the class in the classloader is still verison9,so witness‘s result is reverse 
![1455f13e5edcfda6e154f0471e17003](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33154970/156780176-6b75be05-c13b-4fa7-a2d5-eaffec26236b.jpg)

but my dependencies are verison10:
![1da616d8bbfd7af8148176b29896e73](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33154970/156780351-fa6a48df-1a0f-4a31-9b5d-523bcac92d08.jpg)

I don't know why there is such a confusing situation

But even then it should take effect，because the `StandardHostValue#invoke` 's method signature has not changed

> I don't know why there is such a confusing situation

I assigned to you as you checked `Yes I am willing to submit a PR!` and also propose this. You are the first one proposing this kind of exporting.

> Could you describe the scenario about when do you need this?

The complete metrics information of entities in the dashboard can only be viewed separately. To display the entity metrics information in a table, see the following figure
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22111568/157163387-91904669-a732-454b-b959-71ef9fa6830c.png)
GraphQL style query protocol is for this. We don't have to export everything for this case

> The complete metrics information of entities in the dashboard can only be viewed separately. To display the entity metrics information in a table, see the following figure

The implementation is OK, but the performance is not good,
Export converts the same entity information into one line, and improves the performance of one-time query results

The design of exporting is to make metrics available in 3rd party, so, generally you could build everything else on your own.
What you are doing, I can't say wrong, but strange and special about how to use SkyWalking.
I don't know what do you mean performance is not good. From my understanding, your whole page could be done by a single one-request GraphQL, which should have no performance at all.
